availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Richardson (Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth McCormack in Franklin County, Kentucky on November 18, 1841. Father of John R. Richardson, Owen Richardson, Nathaniel Richardson, Sarah Richardson, George Richardson, Carter Richardson, James D. Richardson, Mary E. Richardson, Bettie Richardson, and William Richardson. Farmer in Franklin County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Franklin County Marriages, Film 000259288.
